title.narrative: Ketsana Emergency Reconstruction and Rehabilitation Project

description.narrative: To restore the service levels of transport and water and sanitation to the affected people in the project provinces and strengthen Royal Government of Cambodia (RGC)'s capacity in disaster preparedness and management

condition.narrative: Adopt and disclose Environmental Management Framework
Carry out M&E using indicators specified
Carry out project in conformity with FM manual agreed under the Avian and Influenza Control Project
Carry out project with provisions of Anti-Corruption and Good Governance Frameworks
Engage FM consultant with appropriate experience and qualifications
Ensure that NCDM will maintain an implementation unit with sufficient resources, qualified, competent staff in adequate numbers,with project manager, procurement officer and FM specialist
Have Financial Statements audited annually and submit audited FS within 6 months of closing
Maintain implementation unit, technical team, managing consultant and financial management consultant
Prepare and furnish to IDA within 45 days after the end of each quarter, interim unaudited financial reports

title.narrative: Percentage of households with access to family latrine sanitation in the targeted villages

comment.narrative: 19.5% of HHs in target villages already had latrines as per theCommune Database 2010.
80%(50% with super-structure by July 31, 2014, and all with super-structure by December 31, 2014)

title.narrative: Percentage of project roads to be returned to pre-disaster levels

comment.narrative: All the roads are completed and 100% achieved with better quality than the pre-disaster level

title.narrative: Percentage of houshold access of family latrine sanitation in the targeted villages
Percentage of water wells built for the target communities (with water quality in compliance with gov't standards)

comment.narrative: 1220 met standard compared to 997 wells minimum

title.narrative: Cumulative percentage of villages with dust controlled roads

comment.narrative: Construction of dust control is substantially completed.

title.narrative: Percentage of family latrine facilities built to improve community sanitation in the target villages

comment.narrative: Most of the family latrines are completed.

title.narrative: Cumulative percentage of reconstructed and rehabilitated affected rural roads in 6 selected provinces
Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Percentage of community household access to improved water supply in the targeted villages

comment.narrative: The wells are completed. The number of villages increased from 150 to 180 due to some dry wells or water quality not compliancewith the standards.

title.narrative: Risk mapping, disaster information and early warning system and building and housing codes developed and applied

actual.value: The three tasks are substentially compoleted and being handed over to the client

comment.narrative: The international consultant substantially completed the tasks and is now handing over to the client
